p: The demographic and clinical information of infected subjects are described in S2 Table. Infected cases were predominantly males, living in the city (urban environment), staying at home and not in daycare units or in the nursery, and living with siblings. Bronchiolitis was the most characterized LRTI within infected subjects. URTIs were defined by laryngitis and pharyngitis. Symptoms including polypnea, dyspnea, anemia, and dehydration were reported. Frequently, respiratory irritation was found, and oxygen support was required in children with positive viral infection. Previous medical history like asthma, passive smoking, and prematurity at birth are outlined.
